result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L Schwinn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $243 court costs imposed in Ct. 1 shall be paid as a condition of probation in Ct. 2.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: Ct. 1

miscConds.notes:
$243 court costs imposed in Ct. 1 shall be paid as a condition of probation in Ct. 2.  
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
No contact with the Sommerfeld's or their residence unless specifically authorized by Defendant's Probation Agent.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle L Schwinn

Sentencing hearing at 08-11-2015 03:30 pm

Def in person & by Atty James E Goldmann.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Resolution reached.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to two counts of misd. theft pursuant to sec. 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a) and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as amended.  Counsel requests an adjourned sentencing hearing.  Sentencing recommendations:  Ct. 1 - 90 days jail w/Huber and $243 court costs; Ct. 2 - 9 months jail w/Huber consecutive to Ct. 1; 24 mos. probation; $243 court costs; no contact with victims or their residences; any conditions recommended by Probation Agent.  8-11-15 Jury trial removed from Court's calendar.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 3:30 p.m.
